title: White billionaire
author: White billionaire
content: https://i.ibb.co/x7x09hH/IMG-20221223-114747.jpgIt's Christmas and I'm back in my hometown to spend the holidays with my family and friends. Today we decided to have lunch at a local restaurant. I was shocked to see the interior walls of the restaurant decorated with Bitcoin stickers, banners and bitcoin wallet ads. I didn't expect to find this in a small town, I was excited to show my friends how practical Bitcoin is. We placed our orders and when the bill came I asked if I could pay in bitcoin. The waiter stared at me with a blank face as if nothing I said made sense. Clearly this guys do not accept Bitcoin payment. I was furious...no disappointed...I quietly asked to see his manager, the lady came to see what the problem. I asked her why they wouldn't accept Bitcoin payments but have the walls decorated with bitcoin stickers, banners and crypto wallet ¬†ads. She explained they have some sort of franchise deal and get paid for keeping the ads on the wall but they don't really know how Bitcoin works or how it can positively impact their business. I could sense she wanted to learn what I knew, but it wasn't the time and place for a Bitcoin lecture. Instead, I invited her for Christmas dinner and promised to teach her Bitcoin. Merry Christmas everyone

comments.body: Quote from: LoyceMobile on December 23, 2022, 06:05:21 PMWhy would you invite a restaurant owner for Christmas dinner?Perhaps for the same reason a professional massage therapist would like a massage or a psychologist a private session?Sometimes people who have specific professions spend years serving their community in such specific areas that they almost forget those days they were on the other side of the bar. But that is only my speculation, since I do not how much that restaurant owner faces the public.OP just wanted to be nice.PD: I am sure if I spent most of my day delivering giant pizzas for months so I can get enough to reach the end of the month, I would not mind the be one abusing Uber-Eats(R) at least for a couple of days.

comments.body: Quote from: LoyceMobile on December 23, 2022, 06:05:21 PMWhy would you invite a restaurant owner for Christmas dinner?I get this may be strange to you understanding there is a cultural difference between us, my community is tightly knit. comments.body: Quote from: LoyceMobile on December 23, 2022, 06:05:21 PMWhy would you invite a restaurant owner for Christmas dinner?Well OP answered that. It took me a while to think of what an answer to the question could be in such a case- in a more populated world (like the western world). But if I had to take a guess: I suppose to either flex ones cooking (kind of a rubbing salt in his face situation) or it would be to brown-nose the owner in hopes of getting special treatment when visiting the restaurant next time.Although having said that, it does make me sound like I may be a bit of a downer with a pessimistic view of the world.

comments.author: The Cryptovator
comments.body: End with a twist. I assumed you discovered a restaurant that accepts Bitcoin. After reading the entire thread, I realized it was nothing but advertisements. However, because the restaurant is near by, it will be easier to teach them how to accept Bitcoin. Because openly advertising Bitcoin implies that it is legal in your jurisdiction. Try to assist them in accepting Bitcoin so that you can keep a supporting role in Bitcoin adoption.
